data.title: Russia's cyber control may damage its ICT industry
data.meta_description: Russia's cyber control may damage its ICT industry
data.text:
Friday, December 15, 2017

Significance

Kaspersky is a top global cybersecurity firm based in Russia. US Senators and the Department of Homeland Security have accused Kaspersky of having links with Russian officials and allowing Moscow to use its software to spy on US politicians.

Impacts

The allegations of links to Russian intelligence could force Kaspersky to retrench its operations.

They are likely to especially hurt the company in the US market.

The Kaspersky case will also make it harder for small start-ups unconnected to state institutions to enter the global market.
